alert.note: Alert for Hot Springs (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 6:32AM MDT until May 14 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Hot Springs. * WHEN...Until 200 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 629 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Rainfall rates have lessened, but additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain could result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Hot Springs County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
